name: get_nutrition_from_image
description: Retrieve nutritional values or calorie content from a food image. Also before calling the function ask for detect the food item and ask for quantity or servingSize consumed

date.description: The current date at the time of user's nutrition request (auto-generated)

time.description: The current date at the time of user's nutrition request (auto-generated)

food_item.description: The name of the food item.

ServingSize.description: ServingSize of the food item consumed (e.g., 2 slices, 1 cup).

protein.description: Essential macronutrient required for building and repairing tissues (g).

total_fat.description: Total amount of fat including all types (g).

saturated_fat.description: Type of fat commonly found in animal products; associated with higher LDL cholesterol (g).

monounsaturated_fat.description: Heart-healthy fats found in olive oil, avocados, and nuts (g).

polyunsaturated_fat.description: Fats that include omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids; beneficial for heart health (g).

trans_fat.description: Artificial or naturally occurring fat linked to increased heart disease risk (g).

cholesterol.description: Waxy substance used in hormone and cell membrane production (mg).

carbohydrates.description: Total carbohydrates including sugars, starches, and fibers (g).

dietary_sugar.description: Total amount of naturally occurring and added sugars in the diet (g).

fiber.description: Indigestible carbohydrate that promotes digestive health (g).

dietary_energy.description: Total caloric value derived from food (kcal).

sugars.description: All sugars including natural and added, synonymous with dietary_sugar in some contexts (g).

sugar_alcohols.description: Low-calorie sweeteners such as xylitol, erythritol, and sorbitol (g).

added_sugars.description: Sugars added during processing or preparation (g).

fiber_detail.description: Detailed breakdown of fiber types, may include soluble and insoluble fiber (g).

alcohol.description: Ethanol content contributing to caloric intake (g).

water.description: Total moisture content in the food (g).

energy.description: Energy content expressed in kilojoules (kJ) or kilocalories (kcal).

starch.description: Complex carbohydrate made of glucose units; provides sustained energy (g).

digestible_carbohydrates.description: Carbohydrates that are absorbed and contribute to blood glucose levels (g).

resistant_starch.description: Type of starch not digested in the small intestine, acts like fiber (g).

glycemic_load.description: Estimate of how much a food will raise a personâ€™s blood glucose level per serving (unitless).

beta_carotene.description: A precursor to vitamin A with antioxidant properties that support vision and immune function (mcg).

vitamin_a.description: Essential for vision, immune defense, and cellular communication (mcg RAE).

vitamin_b1.description: Also known as thiamine, supports energy metabolism and nervous system function (mg).

vitamin_b2.description: Also known as riboflavin, involved in energy production and cellular function (mg).

vitamin_b3.description: Also known as niacin, aids metabolism and supports skin and nervous system health (mg NE).

vitamin_b5.description: Also known as pantothenic acid, essential for synthesizing coenzyme A and metabolizing fats (mg).

vitamin_b6.description: Plays a role in amino acid metabolism and neurotransmitter synthesis (mg).

vitamin_b7.description: Also known as biotin, supports metabolism of fats, carbohydrates, and proteins (mcg).

vitamin_b9.description: Also known as folate, critical for DNA synthesis and red blood cell formation (mcg DFE).

vitamin_b12.description: Necessary for red blood cell formation, neurological function, and DNA synthesis (mcg).

vitamin_c.description: An antioxidant vitamin important for collagen synthesis, immune function, and iron absorption (mg).

vitamin_d.description: Regulates calcium and phosphate metabolism, supporting bone and immune health (mcg).

vitamin_e.description: A fat-soluble antioxidant that protects cell membranes from oxidative damage (mg alpha-tocopherol).

vitamin_k.description: Important for blood clotting and bone metabolism (mcg).

calcium.description: Essential for bone and teeth structure, muscle function, and nerve signaling (mg).

iron.description: Required for oxygen transport in the blood and energy metabolism (mg).

magnesium.description: Supports muscle and nerve function, blood glucose control, and bone health (mg).

phosphorus.description: Works with calcium to build bones and teeth and is involved in energy production (mg).

potassium.description: Helps regulate fluid balance, nerve signals, and muscle contractions (mg).

sodium.description: Essential for fluid balance, nerve transmission, and muscle contraction (mg).

zinc.description: Involved in immune function, wound healing, DNA synthesis, and cell division (mg).

copper.description: Supports iron metabolism, immune function, and the formation of connective tissue (mg).

manganese.description: Involved in bone formation, blood clotting, and reducing oxidative stress (mg).

selenium.description: A trace mineral important for reproduction, thyroid function, and protecting from oxidative damage (mcg).

chromium.description: Plays a role in the metabolism of carbohydrates, fats, and insulin action (mcg).

molybdenum.description: Helps enzymes break down amino acids and drugs in the body (mcg).

iodine.description: Essential for the production of thyroid hormones which regulate metabolism (mcg).

omega-3_fatty_acids.description: Essential polyunsaturated fats (including DHA and EPA) that support brain, heart, and anti-inflammatory health (mg).

omega-6_fatty_acids.description: Essential fatty acids that support skin and hair growth, bone health, and metabolic regulation (mg).

choline.description: A nutrient important for liver function, brain development, and neurotransmitter synthesis (mg).

collagen.description: A structural protein essential for skin, joint, and connective tissue health (mg).

caffeine.description: A natural stimulant that affects the central nervous system to reduce fatigue and improve focus (mg).

lutein.description: An antioxidant carotenoid that supports eye health and protects against age-related macular degeneration (mg).

zeaxanthin.description: A carotenoid concentrated in the retina that supports visual performance and eye protection (mg).

l-Carnitine.description: A compound involved in energy production through the transport of fatty acids into mitochondria (mg).

taurine.description: An amino sulfonic acid important for cardiovascular function, development, and electrolyte balance (mg).

creatine.description: A compound that enhances muscle performance by aiding in ATP regeneration during high-intensity exercise (mg).

coQ10.description: An antioxidant that supports mitochondrial energy production and cardiovascular health (mg).

arginine.description: A semi-essential amino acid involved in nitric oxide production, immune function, and wound healing (mg).

isoleucine.description: A branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) that supports muscle metabolism and immune function (mg).

leucine.description: A BCAA essential for muscle protein synthesis, tissue repair, and energy regulation (mg).

lysine.description: Essential for protein synthesis, hormone production, and calcium absorption (mg).

methionine.description: A sulfur-containing amino acid important for detoxification and as a precursor to cysteine (mg).

phenylalanine.description: A precursor to neurotransmitters like dopamine and norepinephrine; vital for brain function (mg).

tryptophan.description: A precursor to serotonin and melatonin; supports mood regulation and sleep (mg).

valine.description: A BCAA that supports muscle tissue repair, energy production, and mental focus (mg).

docosahexaenoic_acid.description: DHA â€“ an omega-3 fatty acid essential for brain and eye development, commonly found in fish oil (mg).

eicosapentaenoic_acid.description: EPA â€“ an omega-3 fatty acid with anti-inflammatory effects, often sourced from fatty fish (mg).

alpha-linolenic_acid.description: ALA â€“ a plant-based omega-3 fatty acid found in flaxseed, chia seeds, and walnuts; precursor to DHA/EPA (mg).

linoleic_acid.description: An omega-6 essential fatty acid involved in cell membrane integrity and inflammatory response (mg).

oleic_acid.description: A monounsaturated omega-9 fatty acid found in olive oil, associated with heart health benefits (mg).

aspartame.description: A low-calorie artificial sweetener commonly used in diet beverages and sugar-free products (mg).

aucralose.description: Likely a typo â€” assuming this refers to 'sucralose', an artificial sweetener used in baked goods and diet sodas (mg).

saccharin.description: One of the oldest artificial sweeteners, often used in tabletop sweeteners and processed foods (mg).

steviol_glycosides.description: Natural sweet compounds extracted from the stevia plant, used as a sugar substitute (mg).

xylitol.description: A sugar alcohol found in many sugar-free gums and candies; has a cooling effect and can improve dental health (mg).

sorbitol.description: A sugar alcohol with laxative effects at high doses, commonly used in sugar-free foods (mg).

mannitol.description: A sugar alcohol used as a low-calorie sweetener and sometimes in medical settings for diuresis (mg).

erythritol.description: A low-calorie sugar alcohol with minimal impact on blood sugar, often used in keto and diabetic-friendly foods (mg).

monk_fruit_extract.description: A natural sweetener derived from monk fruit, providing intense sweetness with no calories (mg).

allulose.description: A rare sugar with minimal caloric content, used as a sugar alternative in low-carb and keto diets (mg).

maltitol.description: A sugar alcohol used in sugar-free products, has a similar taste to sugar but may cause digestive discomfort (mg).

sodium_benzoate.description: A preservative used to prevent spoilage from microorganisms, commonly found in acidic foods and beverages (mg).

potassium_sorbate.description: A common preservative that inhibits mold and yeast growth in foods, wines, and personal care products (mg).

calcium_propionate.description: A mold inhibitor often added to baked goods and dairy products to extend shelf life (mg).

tartrazine.description: A synthetic lemon yellow dye used in processed foods and drinks, also known as E102 (mg).

allura_red_ac.description: A red azo dye commonly used in snacks, soft drinks, and candies; also known as Red 40 (mg).

name: log_preference
description: Log one or more recognized high-confidence user preferences, constraints, or goals extracted from a user message or pattern across domains like nutrition, activity, schedule, etc

date.description: The date when the preference was stated, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

time.description: The time when the preference was stated (e.g., HH:MM or 'current').

category.description: The high-level category of the preference.

item.description: The content or description of the preference in natural language.

confidence.description: Confidence level in the extraction (only 'high' is allowed).

source.description: Where the preference was derived from (always 'user_statement').
